2021-11-21T15:49:50Z: And that's all from us - the final triple header (of the season) is done and dusted. Eight points in it - the last two rounds will come in a couple of weeks' time. See ya then.
2021-11-21T15:30:47Z: Stroll holds off Sainz and Leclerc, with Norris and Vettel completing the scorers.
2021-11-21T15:30:26Z: Perez comes home in fourth, as Ocon finishes fifth in a decisive strike for Alpine in the constructors' title in its battle versus AlphaTauri.
2021-11-21T15:29:52Z: It's third for Fernando Alonso, his first podium since...2014?
2021-11-21T15:29:05Z: It's a 1m23.196s for Verstappen, who gets second AND the fastest lap point!
2021-11-21T15:28:40Z: Lewis Hamilton wins the 2021 Qatar Grand Prix!
2021-11-21T15:27:09Z: The VSC ends, just as we break into the final lap!
2021-11-21T15:26:56Z: The VSC has been called as Latifi's car needs to be recovered safely from the edge of the circuit. With under two laps to go that might be that in this race.
2021-11-21T15:26:08Z: Verstappen pits for a fresh set of softs!
2021-11-21T15:24:33Z: Norris, who pitted earlier for a second time potentially covering off a puncture fear, moves up to ninth place ahead of Vettel.
2021-11-21T15:24:11Z: Verstappen posts a 1m24.031s, which should cement the fastest lap point.
2021-11-21T15:23:31Z: Alonso is giving it a go now though, keeping the arrears to Perez on that previous lap to just a second.
2021-11-21T15:23:02Z: Latifi cannot make it to the pits and he pulls off the track at Turn 10. That's his race over and everyone else who has one-stopped is in a world of worry for the final three laps of this race.
2021-11-21T15:21:55Z: Four laps to go, and Alonso is going to come under attack from Perez - the Red Bull driver is taking a couple of seconds a lap out of the Alpine.
2021-11-21T15:21:30Z: Now the other Williams has a left-front puncture! Latifi's has gone at the final corner so he has a whole lap to complete on three wheels.
2021-11-21T15:19:42Z: Russell has a puncture! It is the left-front that has gone, like Bottas had earlier, and he crawls back to the pits.
2021-11-21T15:18:27Z: Norris, however, makes Perez's job easier and comes in for a late stop for the mediums.
2021-11-21T15:18:26Z: Ah, it is much worse than we suspected as Bottas is told to pit and retire from the race.
2021-11-21T15:17:38Z: It looks like Bottas might be carrying damage after that trip through the gravel earlier. His pace is slower than all the drivers ahead of him and he's being dropped by Gasly.
2021-11-21T15:17:05Z: Alonso sets a personal best lap to try and build enough of a gap to keep Perez at bay in the final few laps.
2021-11-21T15:15:01Z: But although Ocon runs out of elbows as Perez breezes past at Turn 1 with DRS, he really has a go at Perez in the following corners. Whether that'll be enough to help Alonso, we can but wait.
2021-11-21T15:12:31Z: That's a 1m25.030s for Verstappen now, as the fastest laps continue to be traded.
2021-11-21T15:12:03Z: Not a fun couple of laps for Williams, as Russell gets overtaken by Tsunoda for 14th place.
2021-11-21T15:11:05Z: Perez briefly nicked the fastest lap, but Hamilton now posts a 1m25.295s.
2021-11-21T15:10:56Z: Raikkonen and Latifi come very close to a messy clash at Turn 1 but the Finn opens his steering wheel to avoid bashing into the Williams on the outside of the corner. That sees the Finn up to 16th.
2021-11-21T15:09:43Z: With Hamilton and Verstappen's opening laps completed following their second stops, the gap between them is just under nine seconds.
2021-11-21T15:08:12Z: Bottas is on fightback (part II) as he gets by Ricciardo at Turn 1 to move up to 12th place. The Finn has an 11s gap to bridge to Gasly ahead next.
2021-11-21T15:06:38Z: Perez also calls in from third, taking mediums, as Hamilton stops on lap 42 and claims a set of the yellow-walled tyres too.
2021-11-21T15:05:23Z: Verstappen comes into the pits at the end of lap 41, ditching the hard tyres to pick up a set of mediums.
2021-11-21T15:03:18Z: Tsunoda, on those fresh hards, gets by Latifi to take 15th place around the outside at Turn 1.
2021-11-21T15:01:43Z: Given what has just happened to Bottas and Pirelli's pre-race forecasts about tyre stints and strategies, there could be some nervous teams come the final laps of this race. Bottas is up to 13th, four seconds behind Ricciardo.
2021-11-21T14:59:31Z: Hamilton's lead over Verstappen has grown to 8.4s, and is almost a minute up the road from Perez.
2021-11-21T14:58:14Z: The AlphaTauri duo make their second pitstops on consecutive laps, Tsunoda coming in first to rejoin in 16th and then Gasly who is back out in 11th place.
2021-11-21T14:57:32Z: Gasly, who'd shuffled out in fifth following his early stop, makes the call for a second stop. A new set of mediums for the AlphaTauri driver.
2021-11-21T14:56:40Z: Bottas leaves the pits and comes out in 14th place, right in front of Russell, so his chances of a strong result are gone.
2021-11-21T14:55:10Z: Sparks everywhere on that Mercedes, which finally makes it into the pits - Bottas' long stint gamble hasn't paid off at all! New front wing and hard tyres for the Finn.
2021-11-21T14:53:51Z: Bottas has a puncture! He's gone off-track, as his left front is gone!
2021-11-21T14:53:27Z: It's a 1m26.470s for Hamilton, so there's still time in his pocket. That brings the gap back to Verstappen over the 7s threshold.
2021-11-21T14:52:56Z: Mazepin makes his first pitstop to trade his mediums for softs.
2021-11-21T14:51:32Z: Raikkonen is the first of the two-stoppers to pit again, ditching his mediums for hards to take him to the end, as the Finn comes out in 20th place. Still no retirements from this race.
2021-11-21T14:49:51Z: Ricciardo has lost places to both Vettel and Giovinazzi and is P16 but, so far, it isn't too clear how that happened.
2021-11-21T14:49:37Z: Verstappen posts a 1m26.587s as part of his 'bit of fun', as he tries to close the gap down to Hamilton.
2021-11-21T14:48:34Z: Perez and Alonso now go wheel-to-wheel and, although Alonso tries to defend, the Red Bull eventually dives through at Turn 3. Good racing from the veteran pair.
2021-11-21T14:48:23Z: The only drivers yet to pit in this race are Bottas in third and Mazepin in 19th. Given their respective races, that is where the similarities begin and end.
2021-11-21T14:46:15Z: Sainz pits from fourth after a spate of radio issues, and Leclerc also stops in a double-stack move at Ferrari. Good pair of stops, however.
2021-11-21T14:45:25Z: Leclerc, in a battle with Alonso and Perez, locks up at the start of lap 27, which lets Alonso slip through into fifth. Perez eventually gets through, despite a stern defence from the Ferrari driver.
2021-11-21T14:44:56Z: Ricciardo and Vettel pit together at the end of lap 26. The McLaren driver comes out in P15 with Vettel in P16.
2021-11-21T14:43:35Z: Norris pits from fourth, and takes on the hard tyre to rejoin in 11th behind Gasly.
2021-11-21T14:42:00Z: That is indeed a response - a 1m26.996 for Hamilton this time at the end of lap 25.
2021-11-21T14:41:37Z: Perez, again taking the inside route at Turn 1, overtakes Ricciardo for eighth place with a helpful dose of DRS. He now has Alonso in his sights ahead.
2021-11-21T14:40:54Z: Verstappen finds a 1m27.079s to close up slightly on Hamilton - but Hamilton is responding.
2021-11-21T14:40:02Z: Third-place man Alonso pits, collecting the hard tyre. He rejoins ahead of Ricciardo - and, crucially, Perez.
2021-11-21T14:38:36Z: Bottas now dispatches Norris at the start of lap 23, diving past with DRS, and moves up to fourth.
2021-11-21T14:38:21Z: A lap later Perez tries the inside line at the first corner to fly by Vettel for 11th place.
2021-11-21T14:37:34Z: A 1m27.145s for Hamilton now - Verstappen was on quite a quick lap of a 1m27.3s, but the Mercedes is just quicker.
2021-11-21T14:37:06Z: Perez angles for the outside line against Vettel at Turn 1 but the Aston Martin driver slams the door at the corner exit to keep the Mexican in 12th.
2021-11-21T14:35:28Z: Bottas, meanwhile, seems to be attempting a one-stop - he's currently in fifth sitting behind Norris, who is yet to stop too.
2021-11-21T14:35:15Z: Perez returns to the action down in 12th, behind Vettel, Ricciardo, Leclerc and Stroll, who all need to stop soon. That traffic could play into the hands of Bottas who is going longer in his first stint.
2021-11-21T14:34:35Z: Hamilton does a 1m27.495s on his hard tyre, extending his advantage as of lap 19 to 8.6s.
2021-11-21T14:33:49Z: Perez pits from fourth, coming in for the hard tyre.
2021-11-21T14:31:52Z: Russell has also pitted handing over his mediums for a set of fresh hard tyres.
2021-11-21T14:31:46Z: Mercedes responds and brings in Hamilton who takes on the hard tyre himself, despite asking not to stop early.
2021-11-21T14:30:44Z: Verstappen pits, taking the hard tyre. That's quite early, as the Red Bull emerges ahead of Alonso.
2021-11-21T14:29:38Z: In among the Hamilton fast laps, Perez has passed Norris for fourth. Bottas has also cleared Ocon.
2021-11-21T14:29:14Z: Giovinazzi the next to pit so that's both Alfa Romeos and both AlphaTauris having been down pitlane in this race. The two-by-two pitting formation is pleasing.
2021-11-21T14:27:59Z: Hamilton then did a 1m27.779s to further extend his lead. Pete Bonnington reports that Verstappen appears to be struggling with rear grip, and that overtaking seems to be easier than expected.
2021-11-21T14:26:18Z: As of lap 15, Hamilton's got the gap up to 6.9s - and is continuing to further extend that.
2021-11-21T14:25:25Z: Vettel charges by Russell at Turn 1, taking the inside route, to grab 14th place.
2021-11-21T14:24:59Z: Gasly duly pits from sixth, having had enough of the soft boots. Medium tyres now go onto the #10 car.
2021-11-21T14:24:42Z: Bottas is tucked up behind Sainz but after a couple of looks at Turn 1 he hasn't found a way by yet. The Ferrari driver is also getting a slipstream and DRS boost following behind Ocon.
2021-11-21T14:23:50Z: Perez now puts a move on Gasly at Turn 1, taking fifth place as the French driver begins to struggle on his soft tyres.
2021-11-21T14:22:06Z: Norris has a dip at Gasly into Turn 1 at the start of lap 12, rounding the AlphaTauri and collecting fourth place.
2021-11-21T14:20:49Z: At the end of lap 10 Raikkonen is the second driver to pit in the race, coming out right behind fellow early pitter Tsunoda.
2021-11-21T14:19:45Z: Bottas has started to get a move on after getting a hurry up from Mercedes boss Wolff. The Finn dives up Stroll for ninth place but he is already 28s off the leaders.
2021-11-21T14:19:30Z: Hamilton then does a 1m27.906s on lap 10, so that's an extra half-a-second tacked onto his lead.
2021-11-21T14:18:47Z: Tsunoda pits to ditch his softs for a fresh set of mediums. The AlphaTauri driver comes out in last place.
2021-11-21T14:18:14Z: Hamilton posts a 1m28.127s on lap 9, extending his lead over Verstappen to five seconds.
2021-11-21T14:17:48Z: Tsunoda gets swallowed up by both Stroll and Bottas on lap nine to lose two places at one corner. Stroll on his inside is now ninth and Bottas on his outside is 10th.
2021-11-21T14:16:23Z: Verstappen is worried that he has front wing damage, so he's been asked to stay off the kerbs.
2021-11-21T14:16:15Z: A lap later, Perez perfects the same move on Sainz at Turn 1 and moves up to seventh place. Further back, Ricciardo has overtaken Russell and Giovinazzi to move up to 14th.
2021-11-21T14:15:32Z: If you want to see some action today, stick yourself at Turn 1. Perez sells Sainz the dummy and tries to go on the outside, with the Ferrari driver defending the inside, but the Mexican runs off the racing line and loses out on corner exit.
2021-11-21T14:13:05Z: In free air, Verstappen does a 1m28.166s on lap 5, so it's tete-a-tete between the title contenders.
2021-11-21T14:12:49Z: On lap six Leclerc runs it very tight to Raikkonen but gets the move done at the first corner to move up to 12th place.
2021-11-21T14:11:59Z: And there's another, as Perez dives by Tsunoda at Turn 1 to take eighth place.
2021-11-21T14:11:20Z: Meanwhile, Verstappen passes Alonso to get second now, so it's game on at the front.
2021-11-21T14:11:08Z: The midfield runners remain static in their positions, partly expected given the track characteristics, but DRS has been enabled now so more moves should be possible, particularly at Turn 1.
2021-11-21T14:11:04Z: Verstappen did a 1m30.080s on that lap to get the fastest lap, but Hamilton puts that to the sword with a 1m28.807s to extend his lead.
2021-11-21T14:09:45Z: Gasly goes wide into the final corner at the end of lap 3, which lifts Verstappen up to third with DRS.
2021-11-21T14:07:09Z: Hamilton ends lap 1 with a 1.8s gap over Alonso, who at the same time is trying to gap Gasly, who's got Verstappen behind him. Norris is fifth, with Ocon up to sixth after a mighty start too.
2021-11-21T14:06:52Z: At the start of the second lap, Perez keeps in nailed up the inside of Stroll at Turn 1 to take ninth place.
2021-11-21T14:05:56Z: Meanwhile a poor start for Bottas, going back five places to 11th, and Vettel dropping seven places to 17th place.
2021-11-21T14:05:19Z: Hamilton gets away very well, covering off Gasly, as Alonso sweeps past the AlphaTauri!
2021-11-21T14:04:45Z: Super start by Verstappen moving up to fourth place coming out of the first corner!
2021-11-21T14:04:05Z: Here we go - the Qatar Grand Prix is go go go!
2021-11-21T13:59:43Z: FIFA president Gianni Infantino has turned up with the World Cup trophy. There's already been plenty of penalties today, so it's not out of place here.

2021-11-21T13:55:00Z: We've got 57 laps ahead of us - 0% risk of rain, air temperature of 26.3 degrees C, track sits at 31.1 degrees.
2021-11-21T13:49:53Z: The sidenote of the penalties means that Bottas starts ahead of Verstappen, but the Dutch driver has the clean side of the grid into Turn 1.
2021-11-21T13:41:27Z: Gasly, as a result, moves up to P2 and sits on the front row alongside Hamilton. That's a proper 7/10 strategy.
2021-11-21T13:37:09Z: The FIA wasn't quite sure how the grid shakes up as a result, but it seems that Bottas now starts sixth, with Verstappen starting seventh.
2021-11-21T13:35:55Z: Truly, the Qat has been let out of the bag in the stewards' room.
2021-11-21T13:35:29Z: After Pierre Gasly sustained a puncture in qualifying, there was a period of confusing yellow flags at the end of the lap. Valtteri Bottas got a three-place drop for ignoring a single yellow, Max Verstappen got five places for ignoring double-yellows.
2021-11-21T13:33:52Z: Hello everyone - and welcome to our live updates for the Qatar Grand Prix! Just under 30 minutes until lights out - and boy, has there been a morning of drama.
